thread.title: Bucks F Jabari Parker has a torn ACL, will miss rest of the season | FOX Sports
thread.title_full: Bucks F Jabari Parker has a torn ACL, will miss rest of the season | FOX Sports

author: Dan Graf
title: Bucks F Jabari Parker has a torn ACL, will miss rest of the season | FOX Sports
text:
Feb 9, 2017 at 2:49p ET 0Shares 
Milwaukee Bucks forward Jabari Parker has been one of the breakout stars of the 2016-17 NBA season, but the same injury that delayed that breakout until his third year will sideline him again. 
Parker, the second overall pick in the 2014 draft, fell to the floor Wednesday night after his left knee buckled on a drive to the basket in a loss to the Miami Heat, and an MRI revealed Thursday that he’s torn the ACL in that knee for the second time in his career. Bucks’ Jabari Parker helped off the floor after going down with non-contact knee injury pic.twitter.com/5qPs74fIFq 
— The Crossover (@TheCrossover) February 9, 2017 Jabari's MRI revealed a torn ACL in his left knee, he will undergo surgery and will miss the remainder of the season https://t.co/0ZPxdldBVU 
— Milwaukee Bucks (@Bucks) February 9, 2017 
Parker missed 57 games during his rookie season after tearing the same ACL on a very similar play. Bucks broadcast compares Jabari Parker's 2014 left ACL tear w/ his apparent left knee injury vs. Heat pic.twitter.com/3NK6lndXXi 
— Ben Golliver (@BenGolliver) February 9, 2017 
He didn’t seem to be living up to his draft status until this season, when his scoring and rebounding averages jumped from 14.1 and 5.2 a year ago to 20.1 and 6.2 in 2016-17. 
The Bucks are a disappointing 22-29 and have lost 11 of 13 games largely because they haven’t found help for Parker and All-Star point guard Giannis Antetokounmpo. Their third-best player, shooting guard Khris Middleton, played his first game of the season Wednesday night after recovering from a torn hamstring in the offseason, but Parker went down in the same game. 
Milwaukee has been trying to build momentum toward the opening of a new stadium in two years around an up-and-coming roster, but Parker’s injury will be a significant setback for a team that entered the season hoping to make it to the playoffs for only the fourth time in 12 years.
